create_new_age.ponder.heating.text_1: You can use a Heating Plate to generate heat during daytime.
create_new_age.ponder.heating.text_2: Heat pipes can be used to spread heat around.
create_new_age.ponder.heating.text_12: When provided with heat from below a Stirling Engine will start to slowly rotate.
create_new_age.ponder.heating.text_13: If a Stirling Engine is provided with more heat it will rotate a bit less slowly.
create_new_age.ponder.heating.text_14: You can use a heat pump to pump heat forward!
create_new_age.ponder.heating.text_15: However be careful, if a block overheats, it will turn into lava.
create_new_age.ponder.heater.text_1: The Boiler Heater acts the same way as a blaze burner, however it uses heat instead of burnable fuel.
create_new_age.ponder.heater.text_2: The more heat you provide to it, the more heat it will release.
create_new_age.ponder.reactor.text_1: A nuclear reactor is a great way to generate large amounts of heat.
create_new_age.ponder.reactor.text_2: The first component of a nuclear reactor are the Reactor Rods, which allow for nuclear reaction to take place.
create_new_age.ponder.reactor.text_3: The second component is the Reactor Fuel Inserter which allows you to insert fuel into the reactor.
create_new_age.ponder.reactor.text_4: The final component needed for a nuclear reactor is the Reactor Heat Vent which will collect heat from the reactor and distribute it to connected pipes.
create_new_age.ponder.reactor.text_5: However as one uses the nuclear reactor they must be careful as the nuclear reactor emits deadly radiation.
create_new_age.ponder.reactor.text_6: One can avoid radiation by wearing leather armour or by completely encasing the nuclear reactor in Reactor Casing/Glass.
create_new_age.ponder.reactor.text_7: Additionally you must have something use the heat from the reactor, otherwise you will get a fun little meltdown.
